concept.title: Kafka Connector 3.0 Beta
concept.shortdesc: The Kafka connector provides functionality to stream, filter, and transform events from Couchbase Server to Kafka.

note.p: This is a Beta version of the Kafka Connector 3.0 and is intended for development purposes only. We consider Beta releases to have some rough edges and bugs, and may change significantly before the final GA release. This release is not supported in production.
The Beta release does not support upgrading from an earlier version of Kafka Connector.

conbody.p: The JDBC source connector allows you to import data from Couchbase Server into Kafka topics.

Data is loaded efficiently and reliably using Couchbase's internal replication protocol, DCP. Every change to or deletion of the document generates a replication event, which is then sent to the configured Kafka topic. When copying data from a bucket, the connector loads only new or modified documents.

section.title: Compatibility
section.p: Because the Kafka connector relies heavily on DCP, it is only compatible with Couchbase Server 3.0 and later.

section.title: Contributing
section.p: Couchbase welcomes community contributions to the Kafka connector. The Kafka Connector source code is available on GitHub.
